page.title: 09People, Turvey
page.content: Around 1000 people live in this area. In Turvey itself the biggest age group is the 30-39 years. In 1981 there were 107 children under the age of 10. This will have increased, as new babies seem to be quite a common occurence lately. New births are announced by a postcard on the notice board in the General Stores. Around 70 people have lived in Turvey all their life. Most homes are owner occupied (67%). 17% are council houses and 14% private rented and 2.5% are tied accommodation. People travel to work in a wide area: London, Milton Keynes, Luton, Northampton, Bedford(37%), 25% work in Turvey. Their occupations vary; 35% are employed in the professions and less than 8% have jobs associated with agriculture.
